text: "Blue River" is a 1965 song by Elvis Presley. He released it on a single in December 1965 or January 1966. == Writing and recording == The song was written by Paul Evans and Fred Tobias. Presley recorded it on May 27, 1963 at RCA's Studio B in Nashville, Tennessee. == Track listings == 7" single (RCA 47-8740, 1965 or January 1966) # "Tell Me Why" # "Blue River" 7" single (1965) # "Blue River" # "Do Not Disturb" 7" single (1965) # "Blue River" (2:10) # "You'll Be Gone" (2:20) 7" EP (RCA Victor 86.508 M, France, 1966) # "Blue River" # "Memphis Tennessee" # "Puppet on a String" # "Tell Me Why" == Charts == {| class="wikitable sortable" border="1" |- ! Chart (1965—1966) !
